docs.title: llol_step08 – Dynamic Resume Builder with Flask
📖 Overview
docs.text: llol_step07 is the seventh milestone of an open-source dynamic resume builder aimed at empowering multilingual content creation, real-time editing, and customization. It's built for developers who need structured, localized, and exportable resume content managed through a Flask-based admin interface.

docs.title: 📦 Clone & Setup
docs.text:
Follow these steps to clone the repository and set up your development environment:

git clone https://github.com/TamerOnLine/llol_step08.git  # Clone the project repository from GitHub
cd llol_step08                                            # Navigate into the project directory
python -m venv venv                                       # Create a virtual environment named 'venv'
.\venv\Scripts\Activate                                  # Activate the virtual environment (Windows CMD)
python -m pip install --upgrade pip                       # Upgrade pip to the latest version
pip install -r requirements.txt                           # Install all required dependencies

docs.title: 💡 Tip
docs.text:
If you're using PowerShell, replace the activation command with: 

.\venv\Scripts\Activate.ps1

docs.title: 🎬 Demo
docs.text: 📽️ The video above shows the complete setup process for the llol_step07 repository, from cloning to installing dependencies.

docs.title: 🌐 Internationalization: Running the i18n_translate Module
docs.text:
To automatically generate or update translation files for your project, run the following command:

py -m main.i18n_translate

This module extracts translatable strings, creates .po files for each supported language (if they don't exist), and optionally translates them using automated tools such as deep-translator.

docs.title: 📁 Output
docs.text:
• translations/ folder with updated .po files per language.
  • Automatic generation of .pot template file based on source code and templates.

docs.title: 🎬 Demo
docs.text: 📽️ This tool streamlines the i18n workflow by integrating extraction, translation, and file generation in a single command.

docs.title: 🌍 Features
docs.text:
• 🌐 Multi-language support using Flask-Babel
  • 🔄 Automatic translation using deep-translator
  • 🧾 Live editing of sections, paragraphs, and fields
  • 🎛️ Admin dashboard for dynamic content management
  • 🐘 PostgreSQL as the primary database
  • 🎨 Ready for resume theming and customization

docs.title: 🧩 Database Schema
docs.text:
The resume structure is built dynamically using the following tables:

  • ResumeSection: Top-level sections (e.g., Education, Work Experience)
  • ResumeParagraph: Paragraphs under each section with field_type
  • ResumeField: Key-value pairs inside each paragraph; supports multilingual content
  • Setting: Stores design and display options as JSON
  • LanguageOption: Manages supported languages
  • NavigationLink: Handles sidebar/menu navigation

A ResumeSection contains multiple ResumeParagraphs, and each ResumeParagraph includes multiple ResumeFields.

docs.title: 🎨 Custom Styling via Settings
docs.text:
You can control the appearance of your resume using the admin panel:

  • Section Title Styling: font-size, color, weight
  • Paragraph Styling: font-size, color
  • Body Font: custom font stack

These are stored as JSON in the Setting table and dynamically applied to your resume.

docs.title: 🗂️ Key Files
docs.text: File Purpose main_routes.py Public routes (home, index, language selector) admin_builder_routes.py Admin: section CRUD admin_paragraph.py Admin: paragraph CRUD admin_field.py Admin: field CRUD and reordering i18n_translate.py Auto translation and .po file generation run.py App bootstrap with DB creation

docs.title: 🛠️ Database Setup & .env Configuration
docs.text: Before running the app, you must create the target PostgreSQL database manually and configure environment variables for the connection.

docs.title: ✅ Step 1: Create the .env file
docs.text:
In the root directory of the project, create a file named .env and add the following lines:

DB_NAME=postgreslebenslauf
DB_USER=postgres
DB_PASSWORD=12345
DB_HOST=localhost
DB_PORT=5432
FLASK_DEBUG=True

Replace the values with your actual PostgreSQL credentials.

💡 Note: The database postgreslebenslauf must already exist on your PostgreSQL server. This project does not create the database itself — it only creates tables inside it.

docs.title: ✅ Step 2: Create the PostgreSQL database (if not already created)
docs.text:
You can create the database using any method you prefer:

  • Using psql CLI: 

    createdb -U postgres postgreslebenslauf

  • Inside psql shell: 

    CREATE DATABASE postgreslebenslauf;

  • Using pgAdmin GUI:

  • Open pgAdmin
  • Right-click on Databases → Create → Database
  • Set the name to postgreslebenslauf and save

After completing these steps, you can start the app with:

py -m run

This will: - Connect to the PostgreSQL server using the credentials in .env. - Expect the database postgreslebenslauf to already exist. - Create required tables automatically if missing. - Launch the Flask app in development mode with debugging enabled.

docs.title: 🎬 Demo
docs.text: 📽️ The animation above shows how the application is launched and confirms successful connection to the database.

docs.text:
• ✅ Step 07: Translation engine + dynamic sections
  • 🚧 Step 08: Admin interface for language settings (in progress)
  • ⏭️ Step 09: Display resume content using a ready-made template
  • 📄 Step 10: Export resume to PDF
  • 🎨 Step 11: Fine-tune paragraph formatting
  • 🔜 Step 12: To be determined

docs.title: 👨‍💻 Developer - Connect With Me
docs.text: By @TamerOnLine Under the umbrella of Flask University

docs.title: About
docs.text:
Welcome to the Lebenslauf Project — a modern, flexible, and multilingual resume builder.

This platform is designed to help users create, manage, and publish professional resumes dynamically. Whether you're a developer, designer, or data analyst, you can organize your skills, experiences, and projects with full control over structure, language, and design.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• 🧠 Dynamic section management
  • 🌐 Multilingual content (EN / DE / AR)
  • 🎨 Custom styling and layout control
  • 💾 Built with Flask + Markdown + MkDocs
  • 🔐 Secure and open-source architecture

docs.title: Why This Project?
docs.text: Because every professional deserves a resume that evolves with them — flexible, beautiful, and fully under their control.

docs.title: Privacy Policy
docs.text:
We take your privacy seriously.

This project does not collect, store, or share any personal information unless explicitly stated. All data remains local to your browser or your private environment unless you choose to publish it manually.

docs.title: What We Do Not Do
docs.text:
• ❌ We do not track users
  • ❌ We do not store resumes online
  • ❌ We do not use cookies or analytics

docs.title: If You Contact Us
docs.text:
If you choose to contact us via email or social media, your data is only used to respond to your inquiry and is never shared with third parties.

Questions? Contact us at: info@tameronline.com
